data.title: Invercargill (NZNV)
data.text:
Located in the deep south of New Zealand Invercargill is the southern most domestic airport in the country. Invercargill has a three-gate terminal serving Air New Zealand link flights from Christchurch and Wellington. Along with the domestic traffic, there is a lot of flight training from the Southland Aeroclubs training organisation 'Southern Wings'. Flights to and from Stewart Islands Ryans Creek field are also based in and out of Invercargill.

Event ATC Positions

This airport has additional control positions that are designated for use only during major events.

These non-standard positions must not be staffed unless specifically activated by the VATNZ Airspace Director as part of an official VATNZ event.

At all other times, controllers should use the designated Standard ATC Positions.
